Inventif et très drôle, Portal vous donne envie d'avancer et vous force à vous creuser un peu les méninges. Le jeu constitue même un challenge franchement relevé lorsque l'on tente d'obtenir des médailles dans les salles avancées. Et il a été suivi par ses concepteurs, qui ont ajouté du contenu (les radios à rechercher partout). Un chef d'oeuvre.

Pour les fans, il est même possible de jouer à sa suite, franchement bonne aussi (mais peut-être moins géniale).

In time, attach to the main, nameless character. Getting to know the real purpose of the operation of Aperture Science Laboratories. And this invaluable cake ...

Un gioco che metterà alla prova le vostre abilità intellettive, oltre che una storia innovativa e coinvolgente.

Si inizia con una media difficoltà seguendo le orme della campagna, per poi passare a qualcosa di leggermente difficile nei livelli avanzati, per concludere infine con qualcosa di veramente ostico nelle sfide finali (tempo, numero di passi, portali massimi).

La VALVE regna indiscussa nel genere.

Portal это отличные головоломки и неподражаемый геймплей построенный на смеси обычной физики и порталах плюс фирменный черный юмор!

В игре есть все начиная от шторок для ванной и Утяжелённого Грузового Куба-компаньона до знаменитого тортика которого на самом деле нет... Хотя мы то с вами знаем ;) А GLaDOS вообще неподражаема!!! В игре куча отсылок к играм серии Half-Life.

Вся игра проходятся на одном дыхании и можно легко пропустить множество секретов.

Still Alive один из самых лучших на мой взгляд саундтреков.

Portal is a fun and challenging puzzle game with a great personality. The simplistic controls but mind bottling puzzles will challenge you to think outside the box to solve your tasks. Portal's nature finds itself a place in your heart almost instantly allowing you to be emotionally involved with its amazing cast of characters. However, you'll not only solve puzzles in this adventure, you'll also explore the world around you as you learn about the history of 'science' and how you became involved in this action platformer. Portal is a great game for any audience. Those who want a fantastic story combined with challenging gameplay that makes you think with your head instead of your fingers won't want to miss out on this one!

Perhaps the best thing about the Orange Box is Portal, a short but sweet 3d puzzle game in the 1st person, with and unforgettable sense of humor.... and cake. The game is really incredible, and I expect to see this portal technology used in Half Life 2: Episode 3. This is really a game that everyone must experience.

If you haven't played this yet... what are you, from 2001?  Go play it, and then go play the sequel!  Portal manages to take many of the first-person shooter concepts we know and love, mix in a healthy dose of world-building and puzzle design, and top it off with an amazingly ingenuitive gameplay system and excellent writing and scoring.

Portal mi ha veramente sorpreso! Ha un gameplay diverso da qualunque altro gioco abbia mai giocato. L'idea dei portali è originale ed è il tipo di fantascienza che più apprezzo. GLaDOS, il "cattivo", penso abbia anche vinto un premio come miglior cattivo dell'anno dei videogame. Le IA ciniche e sarcastiche sono esilaranti.

I know that many people that see this wont get it in time, but portal is a game you have to expirience yourself. Honestly, I didnt play it for the first time myself either, I watched a playthrough first, but even that doesn't matter, cuz you see, prtal is a game that's different for evrybody, and the feeling of watching it doesn't compare AT ALL to the feeling of playing it. Portal is a game that- even after playing the sequel first, really touched me and gave me an experience unlike anything else. So yes portal, in one day, you get my seal of approval, good job.

"ポータル"を駆使し、19のチェンバーを突破せよ。
徐々に難易度が上がるステージに対し、
驚くべきギミックや仕掛け、突破法をあなたは見つけるだろう。
そして、テストをサポートする"GLaDOS"の個性さにも注目してもらいたい。

遊び尽くしたら、2周目要素として追加される「ラジオ」を探したり、
上級チェンバーに挑戦･チャレンジマップの追求をしてみても良い。

特に、チャレンジマップの全ゴールド取得は中々の手応えがある。
You Tubeなどに参考動画が多くあるので、挑戦してみてはいかがだろうか。

Portal é um game descontraente, inteligênte e muito criativo.

Voce irá assumir a personagem Chell e terá que passar por várias 
câmeras de testes, resolvendo pluzzes com uma arma de portais.

Durante o jogo todo, você será orientado por GlaDOS, um computador
de inteligência artificial carismático e perigosa, que agora comanda a 
Aperture Science.

Na grande parte do trajeto não há música, e nem precisa, já que o game
requer concentração e raciocínio. A vezes você se depara com alguns 
rádios, que toca um son legal e aconchegante. :)

Portal tem uma jogabilidade super agradável, fácil até mesmo quem 
nunca jogou games de fps, os comandos respondem super bem.

Enfim, o game é legal e irá garantir algumas boas horas de diversão.

Great game! Bonus points for originality for sure. The audio feedback from the narrator is hilarious at times. Can't wait to see what the sequel has in store.

Game: Portal
Genre: Puzzle
Developer: Valve
System: PC
Total Score: 80/100
Value Score: 8.0/10

• Story: 7/10
o Portal's storyline is simple at first sight but complex in nature, although not as dynamic as the story lines you would normally see in other games such as Adventure and RPGs, Portal's storyline dwells around the focus of a silent protagonist who is lead by a robotic figure by the name of GlaDOS. As the storyline unravels itself, the player is not only shown how the technology of Portal evolves and the surrounding origins of those who came before her, but also of the origins and the intentions of GlaDOS as well as her ultimate evolution throughout the game which brings a sense of originality not seen in most other games where they had antagonists forced to evil intentions to death.

• Characters: 5/10
o Portal's character roster is weak, no doubt about it, one of its main weaknesses. You play as Chell who is a silent protagonist who is trying to survive and escape from GlaDOS. Not much is known except for a few tid bits from GlaDOS herself near the climax of the storyline. Despite the fact that it lacks main character power or enemy targets (there are literally 2 types of enemies in the game), GlaDOS herself makes up for at least half of the score. The writing and voice work of the character is so well done, you'll almost forget that there was a lack of character depth and quantity.

• GamePlay: 10/10
o Portal's gameplay features a unique combination of First Person, Adventure and Puzzle. Although at first it may seem like its a pure shooting game, far from it, you use portal guns to create portals and to use as a tool to counter and re-direct enemy fire and attacks. Though that is not its only use as you will strategically move around the 19 levels in the game with the help of the portal guns which will assist you to get through all the obstacles in the levels. The gameplay's basics stem from Valve's history with FPS style games, as you move with the keyboard's WASD, space for Jump and E to open (which is similar to L4D2).

• Graphics: 9/10
o Portal's graphics are simply amazing for a game that came out in its time, one of the first games to go the "8th gen" style in terms of graphics and dynamics, Portal's design is considered heavenly when comparing to games that came out around its time. The character designs are simple yet it has that little odd composure of complexity in its design. Although the game features amazing looking visuals for certain objects and character sprites, however some of the effects and surrounding environment are far from spectacular, although despite that factor, you'll be mesmerized from all the other visuals to even care as 90% of the game will leave you in awe.

• Sound: 10/10
o Portal's voice work is simply amazing, although at first it might not seem much, the voice over from GlaDos and the robots that are in several stages are well done and are quite humorous and enjoyable to listen to. Along with the sound effects from objects clashing with each other, laser sound effects from attacks, the portal sound effects and other surrounding sounds will keep you busy wondering what is ahead and or what is coming. Sound work is simply put Perfection.

• Music: 8/10
o Portal's music is a feature not much of praise worthy, it can be compared to the OSTs of Resident Evil where the music will either keep you calm or make you lose in concentration, there are no "DANGER" themes or anything that will surprise you 24/7 (unless you count the last boss battle theme), majority of the music is forgettable except for a few tracks such as the Radio theme which is quite catchy and the ending theme song which is well made and possibly makes up for the lack of a memorable OST.

• Length: 3/10
o Portal's main weakness is in its hours of game play and length. You have about 19 levels or stages you can go through in the entire game and a boss battle at the end. After that there pretty much isnt anything else you can do storyline wise unless you want to do the bonus maps which does offer a bit more replay value, but does not add up to the overall storyline length. Overall the game should not take you no more than at least 5 hours and that is only if you get stuck along the way, if you easily get past the puzzles and obstacles, your game clock should not be over 3 hours.

• Replay Value: 8/10
o Where Portal lacks in length, it makes up for replay value. You can play the game in its bonus maps and play challenges to unlock certain achievements. The game is also worth playing all over again because of its simple linear path of storyline and puzzles (and unique gameplay).

• Player Value: 10/10
o Portal is a amazing game which all gamers should try out at least once. The game is so worth it, you can get it for a cheap price on Steam, if you are a fan of Puzzles and short games, you will surely love this game. The amazing character GlaDos and the unique gameplay by itself is more than enough reason to get this game now.

This game, although short, is really, really good.  I played about a quarter of Portal 2 on the PlayStation 3 before I played Portal, so I was already familiar with how portals work and I can't really say how easy it was to get the hang of how the game functions.  It wasn't that difficult for me, but it might be for other people.  Essentially, you are a test subject for Aperture Science (I think that's what the company is called), put to work in 19 trials so that the company may observe and test the effectiveness of their "Portal Gun," a gun which can fire two portals that link to each other (so that if you step into one portal you will come out the other).  The 19 tests are absolutely genius, even if they are never too challenging.  The real killer part of the game is surprisingly the endgame, but I won't say anything about that due to spoilers.  All in all, this game is a lot like a Nintendo game, especially Retro's Metroid Prime trilogy (if you only ever acquired one item rather than a ton of upgrades).  The story is excellent but never in your face (note that if you want to get anything out of the story you should really do some exploring), the gameplay is superb, and the characters are very memorable.  The music is almost non-existent, but I enjoyed what was there, and you don't really even notice that the music is missing until you play Portal 2 where there is music everywhere.  My only real complaint about this game is its length (you never realize how short it is while you play it, but I was shocked later to find that I beat the game in three hours) and the lack of proper controller support.  You can actually get controller support by doing some stuff in the game's console, but even after doing so I had trouble and wound up just preferring the mouse and keyboard.  Fortunately, Valve fixed that issue in Portal 2.

Anyway, this is a game to play if you can handle first-person platformers like Metroid Prime, and I encourage you to play all the way to the end.  It is worth it.

Great game. But short story, and no multiplayer

A strange but fun first person puzzle game, I haven’t played anything quite like it before. 
I've always enjoyed a challenge and sometimes the puzzles in this game can be more then that, down right infuriating! I found Portal a very innovative game, it makes you use your brain unlike many of today’s games where you just charge in and see what happens. You need to step back and take a look around and see what your options are before making a decision. 
If you enjoy good challenging puzzler I would definitely recommend this!
